11.mnemonic: Next arrival like His departure

16.mnemonic: Scripture had to be fulfilled

17.mnemonic: Counted with us

18.mnemonic: Intestines of Judas spilled

19.mnemonic: People called it field of blood

20.mnemonic: Let another take his place

21.mnemonic: Experienced companion

22.mnemonic: Needed witness

23.mnemonic: Alternate candidates

24.mnemonic: Master knows hearts

25.mnemonic: Exited ministry (Judas)

26.mnemonic: Designated Matthias by casting lots

Expectant disciples assembled

3.mnemonic: Noise from heaven rushes

4.mnemonic: Tongues like fire appear

5.mnemonic: Each is filled Spirit

6.mnemonic: Crowd hears many languages

7.mnemonic: Observers are bewildered

8.mnemonic: Some ask what means

9.mnemonic: Those mocking claim drunkenness

10.mnemonic: Then Peter stands preaching

11.mnemonic: Opens message to Israel

12.mnemonic: Narrates foretold prophecy

13.mnemonic: God declares last days

14.mnemonic: Universal Spirit outpouring promised

15.mnemonic: Everyone who calls saved

16.mnemonic: Signs above and below

17.mnemonic: Final great day coming

18.mnemonic: Address now men Israel

19.mnemonic: Life of Jesus recounted

20.mnemonic: Lawless hands had crucified

21.mnemonic: Almighty God raised Him

22.mnemonic: Scripture about David explained

23.mnemonic: Prophet foresaw resurrection

24.mnemonic: Exalted Messiah not abandoned

25.mnemonic: Throne promised to David

26.mnemonic: Eyes see fulfilled promise

27.mnemonic: Resurrection witnesses testify

28.mnemonic: Poured out Spirit from Jesus

29.mnemonic: Reassures this not drunkenness

30.mnemonic: Explains Jesus made Lord

3.mnemonic: INVALID HEALED; PETER PREACHES

2.mnemonic: Needy lame man is carried

3.mnemonic: Veteran beggar asks alms

4.mnemonic: Apostles fix their gaze

5.mnemonic: Lame man expects to receive

6.mnemonic: In Jesus name gift given

7.mnemonic: Disabled feet are strengthened

8.mnemonic: He leaps, walks, praises

9.mnemonic: Everyone sees healed man

10.mnemonic: All recognize former beggar

11.mnemonic: Large crowd filled with wonder

12.mnemonic: Explanation begins from Peter

13.mnemonic: Delivered up Gods Servant

14.mnemonic: People denied Holy One

15.mnemonic: Executed Author of life

16.mnemonic: Through Jesus name made strong

17.mnemonic: Everyone acted in ignorance

18.mnemonic: Required sufferings now fulfilled

19.mnemonic: Penitent hearts must turn

20.mnemonic: Restoring times when Christ sent

21.mnemonic: Every prophet spoke beforehand

22.mnemonic: All must heed raised Prophet

23.mnemonic: Consequences for rejecting Him

24.mnemonic: Hebrew prophets announced these days

25.mnemonic: Every family blessed through seed

26.mnemonic: Sent Servant turns from wickedness

4.mnemonic: RESURRECTION TALK SPARKS TRIAL; SHARING ALL

2.mnemonic: Exasperated by resurrection teaching

3.mnemonic: Seize apostles and jail overnight

4.mnemonic: Uncounted thousands now believe

5.mnemonic: Rulers elders scribes assemble

6.mnemonic: Relatives of high priest present

7.mnemonic: Enquire by what power or name

8.mnemonic: Courage-filled Peter addresses council

9.mnemonic: Trial framed as good deed questioned

10.mnemonic: In Jesus name cripple stands whole

11.mnemonic: Old stone prophecy is applied

12.mnemonic: No other name brings salvation

13.mnemonic: They marvel at bold untrained men

14.mnemonic: Astonished by healed man beside

15.mnemonic: Leaders send apostles outside

16.mnemonic: Keep debating undeniable miracle

17.mnemonic: Stop this spreading by strict warning

18.mnemonic: Prohibit speaking in Jesus name

19.mnemonic: Apostles insist God must be obeyed

20.mnemonic: Resolve to speak what they witnessed

21.mnemonic: Keep threatening but find no basis

22.mnemonic: Sign done on man over forty

23.mnemonic: Then released they join their friends

24.mnemonic: Report everything chief priests said

25.mnemonic: Inspired Scripture about raging nations

26.mnemonic: Against the Lord and His Anointed

27.mnemonic: Leaders Herod Pilate Gentiles Israel unite

28.mnemonic: Sovereign plan predestined their actions

29.mnemonic: Hearts now ask for holy boldness

30.mnemonic: As God heals with signs and wonders

32.mnemonic: In one heart they share everything

35.mnemonic: All proceeds laid at apostles' feet

37.mnemonic: Land sold and money laid down

5.mnemonic: INSTANT DEATH FOR LIARS; APOSTLES FLOGGED, REJOICE!

2.mnemonic: Not all proceeds are honestly offered

3.mnemonic: Satan fills his heart to lie to Spirit

4.mnemonic: To God not men has he lied

5.mnemonic: Ananias falls dead and great fear comes

6.mnemonic: Now young men wrap and bury him

7.mnemonic: Three hours later Sapphira comes unaware

8.mnemonic: Demanded price, she repeats the deception

9.mnemonic: Exposed, she hears judgment at the door

10.mnemonic: At once she falls dead beside him

11.mnemonic: Terror seizes whole church and hearers

12.mnemonic: Hands of apostles bring many signs

13.mnemonic: Fearing to join yet favoring them highly

14.mnemonic: Ongoing multitudes of believers added

15.mnemonic: Roads lined with sick seeking Peter's shadow

16.mnemonic: Local towns bring sick and all are healed

17.mnemonic: Incensed high priest and Sadducees grow jealous

18.mnemonic: Apostles are arrested and put in prison

19.mnemonic: Released at night by an angel

20.mnemonic: Sent to speak all this life in temple

21.mnemonic: At daybreak they teach while council convenes

22.mnemonic: Prison found empty by returning officers

23.mnemonic: Observed locked doors yet no prisoners inside

24.mnemonic: Scratching their heads, leaders are perplexed

25.mnemonic: Told that apostles are teaching in temple

26.mnemonic: Led out without violence for fear of crowd

27.mnemonic: Examined before council by high priest

28.mnemonic: Strict charge recalled; city filled with their teaching

29.mnemonic: Firmly they insist on obeying God not men

30.mnemonic: Lifted by God, Jesus whom they killed on a tree

31.mnemonic: Ongoing exaltation as Prince and Savior offering repentance

32.mnemonic: Given Spirit also witnesses with them

33.mnemonic: Grieved and enraged, council wants them killed

34.mnemonic: Esteemed Pharisee Gamaliel stands and intervenes

35.mnemonic: Deliberately warns them to be careful

36.mnemonic: Recounts the failed uprising led by Theudas

37.mnemonic: Exposes similar revolt of Judas the Galilean

38.mnemonic: Judges that human plans will fail on their own

39.mnemonic: Opposing them might mean fighting against God

40.mnemonic: Inflicting flogging, they forbid Jesus' name then release

41.mnemonic: Counting it joy to suffer shame for Christ

42.mnemonic: Every day they keep preaching Jesus as the Christ

6.mnemonic: THEY GRAB STEPHEN

2.mnemonic: Helpers needed so apostles prioritize word

3.mnemonic: Elders tell church choose seven Spirit-filled men

4.mnemonic: Yield apostles to prayer and ministry

5.mnemonic: Group selects Stephen and six others

6.mnemonic: Ritual laying on hands commissions them

7.mnemonic: Apostolic message spreads; priests believe

8.mnemonic: Brilliant wonders done by Stephen

9.mnemonic: Synagogue members argue with Stephen

10.mnemonic: They cannot resist his Spirit-given wisdom

11.mnemonic: Evidence fabricated by secret instigators

12.mnemonic: People leaders scribes seize Stephen

13.mnemonic: Hostile witnesses accuse him against temple and law

14.mnemonic: Explain he said Jesus changes customs

15.mnemonic: Noticed his face looking like an angel

7.mnemonic: BOLDLY RECOUNTING ISRAEL'S HISTORY, STEPHEN IS STONED TO DEATH NEAR SAUL

2.mnemonic: Opening with God appearing to Abraham

3.mnemonic: Leaves his homeland by faith

4.mnemonic: Directed to new land God shows

5.mnemonic: Landed there yet no inheritance

6.mnemonic: Yet promise given to his offspring

7.mnemonic: Rescue foretold after slavery

8.mnemonic: Entered covenant of circumcision

9.mnemonic: Children of Jacob envy Joseph

10.mnemonic: Oppressed him by selling to Egypt

11.mnemonic: Unrelenting famine strikes region

12.mnemonic: News of grain brings first visit

13.mnemonic: True identity revealed on second

14.mnemonic: Israel invited to dwell in Egypt

15.mnemonic: Numbered ancestors buried in tomb

16.mnemonic: Growing people multiply in Egypt

17.mnemonic: In time another king arises

18.mnemonic: Shrewd ruler oppresses our race

19.mnemonic: Required to expose their babies

20.mnemonic: A child Moses is born

21.mnemonic: Egyptian household raises him

22.mnemonic: Learned in all wisdom of Egypt

23.mnemonic: Sets heart to visit his brothers

24.mnemonic: Helps by striking oppressor

25.mnemonic: Israelite rejects his leadership

26.mnemonic: Says who made you ruler

27.mnemonic: Terrified Moses flees to Midian

28.mnemonic: Out in exile he fathers sons

29.mnemonic: Revelation comes by burning bush

30.mnemonic: You stand now on holy ground

32.mnemonic: To send Moses back as ruler

34.mnemonic: People led through sea and wilderness

35.mnemonic: He is with them at Sinai

38.mnemonic: In their hearts turn to Egypt

39.mnemonic: Saying make us gods to follow

40.mnemonic: Shaping calf and rejoicing in idols

45.mnemonic: David desires a house for God

47.mnemonic: Only Most High not housed by hands

49.mnemonic: Ears and hearts always resist Spirit

50.mnemonic: As your fathers did so you

55.mnemonic: As Stephen sees glory of God

59.mnemonic: Under stones he prays for enemies

8.mnemonic: OUTWARD PRESSURE; PHILIP BAPTIZES AN ETHIOPIAN

2.mnemonic: Upright men bury Stephen mournfully

3.mnemonic: Tearing homes apart, Saul seizes believers

4.mnemonic: Word proclaimed wherever they are scattered

5.mnemonic: Arriving in Samaria, Philip proclaims Christ

6.mnemonic: Responsive crowds heed signs and wonders

7.mnemonic: Demons flee and disabled are healed

8.mnemonic: People of that city rejoice greatly

9.mnemonic: Renowned magician Simon amazes Samaria

10.mnemonic: Esteemed as the Great Power of God

11.mnemonic: Spellbound people follow his sorcery

12.mnemonic: Samarians now believe and are baptized

13.mnemonic: Upon believing, Simon stays with Philip

14.mnemonic: Report reaches Jerusalem about Samaria

15.mnemonic: Elders Peter and John are sent

16.mnemonic: Previously only baptized in Jesus' name

17.mnemonic: Hands laid so they receive Spirit

18.mnemonic: Impressed, Simon offers them money

19.mnemonic: Longs for same power to impart Spirit

20.mnemonic: Indignant Peter condemns his silver

21.mnemonic: Part or share denied; heart not right

22.mnemonic: Bid to repent from this wickedness

23.mnemonic: Aware he is in bitter bondage

24.mnemonic: Pleading, Simon asks them to pray

25.mnemonic: Testifying, they preach through Samaritan villages

26.mnemonic: Instruction from angel sends Philip south

27.mnemonic: Zealous Ethiopian official travels from worship

28.mnemonic: Engrossed, he reads the prophet Isaiah

29.mnemonic: Spirit tells Philip to approach chariot

30.mnemonic: Asking, Philip inquires about his understanding

31.mnemonic: Needing guidance, eunuch invites Philip up

32.mnemonic: Excerpt describes lamb led to slaughter

33.mnemonic: Trampled in humiliation, justice denied Him

34.mnemonic: Humbly eunuch asks who prophet describes

36.mnemonic: On seeing water, eunuch requests baptism

38.mnemonic: Immersed in water, he is baptized

40.mnemonic: Now Philip preaches from Azotus to Caesarea

9.mnemonic: ROAD TO DAMASCUS; PETER RAISES TABITHA FROM THE DEAD

2.mnemonic: Orders requested to arrest believers

3.mnemonic: Approaching Damascus, a light flashes

4.mnemonic: Down he falls at a heavenly voice

5.mnemonic: The Lord Jesus reveals Himself

6.mnemonic: Obediently he is led toward instructions

7.mnemonic: Dumbstruck companions hear but see nothing

8.mnemonic: A blind Saul is led into Damascus

9.mnemonic: Meanwhile three days pass without sight or food

10.mnemonic: Ananias receives a vision from the Lord

11.mnemonic: Street called Straight holds the waiting Saul

12.mnemonic: Coming visitor is shown to Saul in vision

13.mnemonic: Uncertainty from Ananias about this persecutor

14.mnemonic: Sanctioned by priests to seize the saints

15.mnemonic: Personally chosen as instrument to the nations

16.mnemonic: Expected sufferings foretold for Saul

17.mnemonic: Touching him, Ananias calls him brother

18.mnemonic: Eyes are opened and he is baptized

19.mnemonic: Recovered strength while staying with disciples

20.mnemonic: Rapidly he proclaims Jesus as Son of God

21.mnemonic: Amazed hearers recall his former violence

22.mnemonic: Increasingly he confounds the Jews in Damascus

23.mnemonic: Secret plot forms to kill Saul

24.mnemonic: Exposed conspiracy keeps watch at the gates

25.mnemonic: Suspended in a basket, Saul escapes by night

26.mnemonic: Terrified disciples doubt Sauls conversion

27.mnemonic: Advocate Barnabas presents Saul to apostles

28.mnemonic: Boldly he speaks in the name of Jesus

29.mnemonic: Intense debates provoke another death plot

30.mnemonic: Transported away to Tarsus for safety

31.mnemonic: Healthy church grows in peace and Spirit

32.mnemonic: Apostle Peter travels to visit the saints

33.mnemonic: Flat on his bed lies Aeneas, paralyzed

35.mnemonic: Over Lydda and Sharon many turn to the Lord

36.mnemonic: Merciful disciple Tabitha serves the needy in Joppa

37.mnemonic: Then she falls sick and is laid out dead

38.mnemonic: Hastily two men hurry to fetch Peter

39.mnemonic: Evidence of her kindness is displayed by widows

40.mnemonic: Doors closed as Peter prays and calls her to arise

41.mnemonic: Eyes open and she sits upright alive

42.mnemonic: Amazing news spreads and many believe in the Lord

43.mnemonic: Dwelling in Joppa, Peter stays with Simon the tanner

10.mnemonic: NON-JEWS RECEIVE THE HOLY SPIRIT WHILE PETER IS PREACHING

2.mnemonic: Orders given to devout household

3.mnemonic: Noted as God-fearing and generous

4.mnemonic: Justice-seeking angel appears in vision

5.mnemonic: Explains that God has heard his prayers

6.mnemonic: Words instruct him to send to Joppa

7.mnemonic: Servants and soldier dispatched to Peter

8.mnemonic: Roof-top Peter goes up to pray

9.mnemonic: Extremely hungry, he falls into trance

10.mnemonic: Canvas-like sheet descends from heaven

11.mnemonic: Entered are all kinds of animals

12.mnemonic: Instruction comes to kill and eat

13.mnemonic: Voice forbids calling them unclean

14.mnemonic: Event happens three times then sheet taken

15.mnemonic: Thinking deeply, Peter wonders its meaning

16.mnemonic: House guests from Cornelius arrive below

17.mnemonic: Explained by Spirit that Peter must go

18.mnemonic: Hears that three men are seeking him

19.mnemonic: Offers lodging and next day travels

20.mnemonic: Large gathering awaits him in Caesarea

21.mnemonic: Yielding himself, Cornelius falls at his feet

22.mnemonic: Stops him, saying I myself am a man

23.mnemonic: People assembled to hear the message

24.mnemonic: Informing them God shows no favoritism

25.mnemonic: Reaching all nations, good news is preached

26.mnemonic: Israel knows how word spread from Galilee

27.mnemonic: Testifying that God anointed Jesus with Spirit

28.mnemonic: Went about doing good and healing

29.mnemonic: Him they killed by hanging on a tree

30.mnemonic: In three days God raised Him up

31.mnemonic: Later He appeared to chosen witnesses

32.mnemonic: Everyone is commanded to preach this

33.mnemonic: Proclaiming He will judge living and dead

35.mnemonic: Through His name all who believe receive remission

36.mnemonic: Empowered listeners receive the Holy Spirit

37.mnemonic: Right then the Spirit falls on hearers

38.mnemonic: In astonishment Jewish believers are amazed

39.mnemonic: Spirit-gift tongues and praise are heard

40.mnemonic: Peter asks if anyone can withhold water

41.mnemonic: Recognizes they received Spirit just as we

42.mnemonic: Everyone is commanded to be baptized in Jesus name

43.mnemonic: Asked him to remain with them some days

44.mnemonic: Confirming God accepts these Gentile believers

45.mnemonic: Holy excitement spreads among the brethren

47.mnemonic: New Gentile disciples rejoice in salvation

11.mnemonic: CHRISTIAN CHURCH BEGINS AT ANTIOCH

2.mnemonic: Hearing Peter ate with uncircumcised

3.mnemonic: Responders accuse him of visiting them

4.mnemonic: In order Peter explains his vision

5.mnemonic: Sheet from heaven seen in Joppa trance

6.mnemonic: Told three times not to call unclean

7.mnemonic: In that moment three men arrived

8.mnemonic: Accompanied by six brothers he went

9.mnemonic: Narrates Spirit falling on them like us

10.mnemonic: Christ's promise about Spirit remembered

11.mnemonic: Hindering God would be impossible

12.mnemonic: Upon hearing this they fall silent

13.mnemonic: Recognize God grants Gentiles repentance

14.mnemonic: Christians scattered preach in Phoenicia Cyprus

15.mnemonic: Hellenists in Antioch hear Lord Jesus

16.mnemonic: Believing crowds turn to the Lord

17.mnemonic: Elders in Jerusalem send Barnabas

18.mnemonic: Grace of God seen and he rejoices

19.mnemonic: Instructs all to remain true to Lord

20.mnemonic: Numerous people are added to the Lord

21.mnemonic: Saul sought by Barnabas in Tarsus

22.mnemonic: At Antioch they teach together one year

23.mnemonic: There disciples first called Christians

24.mnemonic: Arriving prophets come down from Jerusalem

25.mnemonic: Named Agabus foretells a great famine

26.mnemonic: Then disciples decide to send relief

27.mnemonic: In proportion each contributes support

28.mnemonic: Offering sent to Judean elders

29.mnemonic: Carried by Barnabas and Saul

30.mnemonic: Help reaches brothers in Jerusalem

12.mnemonic: HEROD KILLS JAMES; PETER SAVED

2.mnemonic: Executes James the brother of John

3.mnemonic: Recognizes Jewish pleasure and seizes Peter

4.mnemonic: Orders him guarded awaiting public trial

5.mnemonic: Devoted church offers earnest prayer

6.mnemonic: Kept in chains between two soldiers

7.mnemonic: In cell an angel appears suddenly

8.mnemonic: Light shines; chains fall off

9.mnemonic: Led by angel to dress and follow

10.mnemonic: Steps past guards; gate opens itself

11.mnemonic: Just then Peter realizes the Lord rescued him

12.mnemonic: Arrives at Marys house where many pray

13.mnemonic: Maid Rhoda hears Peter at the door

14.mnemonic: Ecstatic, she runs without opening

15.mnemonic: Skeptical believers say it is his angel

16.mnemonic: Peter keeps knocking; they are amazed

17.mnemonic: Explains his rescue and departs elsewhere

18.mnemonic: Turmoil among soldiers at daybreak

19.mnemonic: Examined guards executed; Herod goes to Caesarea

20.mnemonic: Resentful toward Tyre and Sidon yet hears them

21.mnemonic: Seated in royal robes he gives an address

22.mnemonic: Acclaim of people calls him a god

23.mnemonic: Visited by angel, he is struck down

24.mnemonic: Ever more the word of God spreads

25.mnemonic: Duty finished, Barnabas and Saul depart with John Mark

13.mnemonic: UPSETTING TOP JEWS, PAUL AND BARNABAS PREACH IN THE SYNAGOGUES

1.mnemonic: United prophets and teachers at Antioch minister

2.mnemonic: Praying and fasting, they hear the Spirit speak

3.mnemonic: Setting apart Barnabas and Saul for the work

4.mnemonic: Escorted by the Spirit, they sail from Seleucia

5.mnemonic: Teaching the word in Salamis with John assisting

6.mnemonic: Through the whole island they travel to Paphos

7.mnemonic: In Paphos they encounter magician Bar-Jesus

8.mnemonic: Near the proconsul Sergius Paulus this conflict arises

9.mnemonic: Glaring at Elymas, Paul is filled with the Spirit

10.mnemonic: Threat pronounced of temporary blindness on the deceiver

11.mnemonic: Over him falls mist and darkness immediately

12.mnemonic: Proconsul believes, astonished at the Lords teaching

13.mnemonic: Journey continues from Paphos to Perga in Pamphylia

14.mnemonic: Entering the synagogue at Pisidian Antioch they sit

15.mnemonic: Words of the Law and Prophets are read

16.mnemonic: Standing, Paul addresses Israel and God-fearers

17.mnemonic: Powerful God chose the fathers and exalted the people

18.mnemonic: After Egypt He led them out with mighty arm

19.mnemonic: Under His patience forty years in wilderness

20.mnemonic: Land of Canaan given after nations destroyed

21.mnemonic: Asked for judges until the prophet Samuel

22.mnemonic: Next they requested a king and received Saul

23.mnemonic: David raised up, a man after Gods own heart

24.mnemonic: Bringing from his seed the Savior Jesus as promised

25.mnemonic: Already John had preached repentance before His coming

26.mnemonic: Refusing Messiah John said he was not the One

27.mnemonic: News of this salvation now sent to them

28.mnemonic: Authorities in Jerusalem fulfilled the prophets by condemning Him

29.mnemonic: Body was taken down from the tree and laid in a tomb

30.mnemonic: Almighty God raised Him again from the dead

31.mnemonic: Seen many days by witnesses who now preach

32.mnemonic: Promised good news is that God fulfilled it to their children

33.mnemonic: Raised Jesus as written in the second psalm

34.mnemonic: Expressly God promises no return to decay

35.mnemonic: Another psalm says His Holy One will not see corruption

36.mnemonic: Corruption befell David after serving his generation

37.mnemonic: However the One God raised did not see decay

38.mnemonic: In this man is proclaimed forgiveness of sins

39.mnemonic: Now by Him everyone who believes is justified

40.mnemonic: Take care lest the prophetic warning fall on you

41.mnemonic: Habakkuks words about scoffers are applied to them

42.mnemonic: Earnestly the people beg to hear these words again

43.mnemonic: Some Jews and proselytes follow and are urged to continue in grace

44.mnemonic: Yet on the next Sabbath nearly the whole city gathers

45.mnemonic: Now the jealous Jews contradict and blaspheme

46.mnemonic: Announcing boldly, Paul and Barnabas turn to Gentiles

47.mnemonic: Given as a light to the nations according to prophecy

48.mnemonic: Overjoyed, the Gentiles honor the word of the Lord

49.mnemonic: Glad news of the Lord spreads through the whole region

50.mnemonic: Under pressure, leading people stir up persecution

51.mnemonic: Exiting the district, they shake dust from their feet

52.mnemonic: Spirit brings joy as disciples are filled with the Holy Spirit

14.mnemonic: RAISING A CRIPPLED MAN TO HIS FEET

1.mnemonic: Reaching Iconium they speak in the synagogue

2.mnemonic: Agitating Jews stir up and embitter Gentiles

3.mnemonic: In that city they stay long speaking boldly

4.mnemonic: Sides form as the people are divided over them

5.mnemonic: Intended assault to mistreat and stone the apostles

6.mnemonic: Noticing the plot they flee to Lystra and Derbe

7.mnemonic: Gospel continues to be preached in those regions

8.mnemonic: At Lystra sits a man lame from birth

9.mnemonic: Carefully he listens to Paul speaking

10.mnemonic: Raised by a loud command he leaps and walks

11.mnemonic: Impressed crowds cry that the gods have come down

12.mnemonic: People call Barnabas Zeus and Paul Hermes

13.mnemonic: Priest of Zeus brings oxen and garlands to sacrifice

14.mnemonic: Learning this the apostles tear garments and rush out

15.mnemonic: Exhorting them to turn from vain idols to the living Creator

16.mnemonic: During past generations God let nations walk their own ways

17.mnemonic: Mercifully He gave rain seasons food and glad hearts

18.mnemonic: All their words scarcely restrain the crowds from sacrifice

19.mnemonic: Now hostile Jews arrive and persuade the crowds to stone Paul

20.mnemonic: Then disciples gather and he rises to enter the city

21.mnemonic: Onward from Derbe they return to Lystra Iconium and Antioch

22.mnemonic: Helping the disciples they strengthen souls to remain in the faith

23.mnemonic: In every church they appoint elders with prayer and fasting

24.mnemonic: So passing through Pisidia they come into Pamphylia

25.mnemonic: From Perga they preach the word and go down to Attalia

26.mnemonic: Embarking from there they sail back to Antioch of commissioning

27.mnemonic: Explaining all God has done they tell of the opened door of faith

28.mnemonic: There they stay a long time with the disciples

15.mnemonic: CIRCUMCISION DEBATE INVOLVES PAUL AND BARNABAS

1.mnemonic: Certain men demand circumcision for salvation

2.mnemonic: Intense dispute sends Paul and Barnabas

3.mnemonic: Reporting Gentile conversion while traveling north

4.mnemonic: Church in Jerusalem welcomes their report

5.mnemonic: Urgent Pharisee believers insist on law

6.mnemonic: Meeting of apostles and elders convenes

7.mnemonic: Contentious debate ends as Peter rises

8.mnemonic: Insight from God giving Spirit to Gentiles

9.mnemonic: Separating no longer between us and them

10.mnemonic: Imposing a yoke would test God

11.mnemonic: Only through Jesus' grace are we saved

12.mnemonic: Now the whole assembly falls silent

13.mnemonic: Discussion shifts as James answers

14.mnemonic: Explains Simeons account of first Gentile converts

15.mnemonic: Biblical prophets agree with this

16.mnemonic: Afterward God will rebuild Davids fallen tent

17.mnemonic: That the rest of humanity may seek Him

18.mnemonic: Everything God planned is known from ages

19.mnemonic: In my judgment we should not trouble Gentiles

20.mnemonic: Non-Jews must abstain from idols immorality blood

21.mnemonic: Venerable Moses is read every Sabbath

22.mnemonic: Ordained messengers Judas and Silas chosen

23.mnemonic: Letter sent to Antioch Syria Cilicia

24.mnemonic: Voices from us did not authorize the troublemakers

25.mnemonic: Eagerly we send beloved Barnabas and Paul

26.mnemonic: Servants who risked their lives for Jesus

27.mnemonic: Personally we send Judas and Silas to confirm

28.mnemonic: Agreed with the Holy Spirit to impose no extra burdens

29.mnemonic: Urged to avoid idols blood strangled and sexual sin

30.mnemonic: Letter delivered to rejoicing Antioch church

31.mnemonic: All are encouraged by its message

32.mnemonic: Notably Judas and Silas strengthen the believers

33.mnemonic: Dismissed in peace back to Jerusalem

34.mnemonic: But Silas chooses to remain there

35.mnemonic: Antioch ministry continues with Paul and Barnabas

36.mnemonic: Return visit proposed to check every church

37.mnemonic: Normally Barnabas wants to bring John Mark

38.mnemonic: Against this Paul objects to taking deserter

39.mnemonic: Bitter disagreement leads them to separate

40.mnemonic: Appointed by brothers, Paul departs with Silas

41.mnemonic: Strengthening churches throughout Syria and Cilicia

16.mnemonic: HOUSEHOLDS OF LYDIA AND JAILER REJOICE IN FAITH

2.mnemonic: Opinion of believers favors Timothy

3.mnemonic: Undergoes circumcision because of Jews

4.mnemonic: So they deliver Jerusalem decrees

5.mnemonic: Ecclesias grow strengthened in faith

6.mnemonic: Holy Spirit forbids word in Asia

7.mnemonic: Onward toward Bithynia yet Spirit stops

8.mnemonic: Unable to enter they reach Troas

9.mnemonic: Summoned by Macedonian man for help

10.mnemonic: Eagerly they conclude God is calling

11.mnemonic: Out from Troas they sail westward

12.mnemonic: From there they arrive at Philippi

13.mnemonic: Looking for prayer they meet women

14.mnemonic: Yonder Lydia purple dealer believes

15.mnemonic: Drenched in baptism her household joins

16.mnemonic: Ingoing to prayer slave girl appears

17.mnemonic: Announcing them servants of Most High

18.mnemonic: Annoyed Paul commands spirit away

19.mnemonic: No profit left owners seize them

20.mnemonic: Dragged before magistrates as disturbers

21.mnemonic: Jewish customs accused of opposing Rome

22.mnemonic: Attacked and beaten with many rods

23.mnemonic: Imprisoned under strict guarding orders

24.mnemonic: Locked in inner cell with stocks

25.mnemonic: Even at midnight they sing hymns

26.mnemonic: Rumbling earthquake opens doors and chains

27.mnemonic: Realizing doors open jailer despairs

28.mnemonic: Eagerly Paul shouts Do not harm yourself

29.mnemonic: Jailer trembling falls before them

30.mnemonic: Out he asks What must I do

31.mnemonic: In believing on Jesus comes salvation

32.mnemonic: Christs word spoken to all household

33.mnemonic: Eager jailer washes wounds and is baptized

34.mnemonic: Invites them home rejoicing in belief

36.mnemonic: From the jailer comes news of freedom

37.mnemonic: As Romans they demand public apology

38.mnemonic: Informed magistrates grow afraid of wrongdoing

39.mnemonic: They try to appease and urge departure

40.mnemonic: Home with Lydia they encourage believers

17.mnemonic: BEREANS BELIEVE AND PAUL TALKS IN ATHENS

1.mnemonic: Beside Amphipolis and Apollonia they reach Thessalonica

2.mnemonic: Each Sabbath Paul reasons in the synagogue

3.mnemonic: Revealing from Scripture that Christ must suffer and rise

4.mnemonic: Expectant Jews and Greeks believe, including leading women

5.mnemonic: Angry Jews stir up a mob and attack Jason's house

6.mnemonic: Not finding them, they drag Jason before the city rulers

7.mnemonic: Saying they preach another king, Jesus, against Caesar

8.mnemonic: Both people and rulers are troubled by these accusations

9.mnemonic: Enforced security taken from Jason before releasing them

10.mnemonic: Led away by night, Paul and Silas go to Berea

11.mnemonic: In Berea they meet noble hearers who search Scriptures daily

12.mnemonic: Eager examination leads many Jews and Greeks to believe

13.mnemonic: Vengeful Thessalonian Jews arrive and agitate the crowds

14.mnemonic: Escorted away, Paul departs while Silas and Timothy stay

15.mnemonic: Athens becomes Pauls next stop as escorts leave him there

16.mnemonic: Noticing the city full of idols, his spirit is provoked

17.mnemonic: Daily he reasons in synagogue and marketplace with hearers

18.mnemonic: Philosophers debate him about Jesus and the resurrection

19.mnemonic: Arrested attention brings him to the Areopagus council

20.mnemonic: Unfamiliar teaching makes them ask what these things mean

21.mnemonic: Lovers of novelty spend time hearing some new thing

22.mnemonic: Taking his stand on Mars Hill, Paul addresses Athenians

23.mnemonic: Altar to an unknown god becomes his starting point

24.mnemonic: Lord of heaven and earth made all and needs no temple

25.mnemonic: Keeper of life and breath, God needs nothing from us

26.mnemonic: Single origin of nations and their boundaries is declared

27.mnemonic: In hope they should seek God who is not far from any

28.mnemonic: Noting poets, he says in Him we live and are His offspring

29.mnemonic: As Gods offspring we must not reduce Him to crafted idols

30.mnemonic: Times of ignorance overlooked; now God commands all to repent

31.mnemonic: He has set a day to judge the world by the risen Man

32.mnemonic: Encountering resurrection talk, some mock and others postpone

33.mnemonic: No longer speaking, Paul departs from their midst

34.mnemonic: Some join him and believe, including Dionysius and Damaris

18.mnemonic: EPHESUS AND CORINTH RECEIVE PAUL

1.mnemonic: Exits Athens and travels to Corinth

2.mnemonic: Partners with Aquila and Priscilla tentmakers

3.mnemonic: He lives and works together with them

4.mnemonic: Each Sabbath he reasons in the synagogue

5.mnemonic: Silas and Timothy arrive and he testifies Jesus

6.mnemonic: Under opposition he declares he will go to Gentiles

7.mnemonic: Steps into Titius Justus house beside the synagogue

8.mnemonic: Authority Crispus believes and many Corinthians are baptized

9.mnemonic: Night vision encourages Paul not to fear

10.mnemonic: Divine promise of protection and many people

11.mnemonic: Continues teaching there for a year and six months

12.mnemonic: Opposed again when Jews haul him before Gallio

13.mnemonic: Religious charge claims he teaches contrary to the law

14.mnemonic: Intentionally Gallio refuses to hear the case

15.mnemonic: Names and words of their law he leaves to them

16.mnemonic: Throws them out of the tribunal

17.mnemonic: Hostile crowd beats Sosthenes while Gallio ignores it

18.mnemonic: Remains a while then sails for Syria with the couple

19.mnemonic: Enters Ephesus and reasons with Jews in the synagogue

20.mnemonic: Crowd invites him to stay longer but he declines

21.mnemonic: Entrusts future return to Gods will and departs

22.mnemonic: In Caesarea he greets the church then goes to Antioch

23.mnemonic: Visits Galatia and Phrygia strengthening all disciples

24.mnemonic: Eloquent Apollos from Alexandria arrives at Ephesus

25.mnemonic: Passionately he teaches Jesus yet knows only Johns baptism

26.mnemonic: Aquila and Priscilla explain Gods way more accurately

27.mnemonic: Urged to go to Achaia he is warmly welcomed and helps believers

28.mnemonic: Loudly he refutes Jews from Scripture proving Jesus is the Christ

19.mnemonic: ARTEMIS ARTISTS' ANGRY ASSEMBLY AGAINST THE WAY

1.mnemonic: Arriving at Ephesus Paul finds disciples

2.mnemonic: Realizes they know only Johns baptism

3.mnemonic: Teaches them about faith in Jesus

4.mnemonic: Expectant disciples are baptized in His name

5.mnemonic: Marked by hands laid, Spirit comes on them

6.mnemonic: Instantly they speak in tongues and prophesy

7.mnemonic: Strength totals about twelve men

8.mnemonic: Again Paul speaks boldly in the synagogue

9.mnemonic: Resisting hearts become stubborn and slander the Way

10.mnemonic: Transferring to Tyrannus hall he teaches daily

11.mnemonic: In all Asia both Jews and Greeks hear

12.mnemonic: Supernatural miracles God does through Paul

13.mnemonic: Taken cloths and aprons bring healing and deliverance

14.mnemonic: Some itinerant exorcists invoke Jesus name

15.mnemonic: Attempting to copy Paul, seven sons confront a spirit

16.mnemonic: Named by demon who knows Jesus and Paul

17.mnemonic: Gripped men are overpowered and flee naked

18.mnemonic: Residents of Ephesus fear and honor Jesus name

19.mnemonic: Yielding believers confess and expose their deeds

20.mnemonic: Arcane scrolls are burned in great number

21.mnemonic: Sum of their value is very great

22.mnemonic: So the word of the Lord grows mightily

23.mnemonic: Envisions future travel to Jerusalem then Rome

24.mnemonic: Ministry continues in Asia while he sends helpers

25.mnemonic: Business of silver shrines declines for Demetrius

26.mnemonic: Loudly he rallies fellow craftsmen about Artemis

27.mnemonic: Yelling that Paul discredits their goddess and trade

28.mnemonic: All the city is filled with confusion

29.mnemonic: Grabbing Gaius and Aristarchus they rush to the theater

30.mnemonic: Aspiring to speak, Paul is held back by disciples

31.mnemonic: Influential Asiarch friends warn him not to enter

32.mnemonic: No one agrees why the assembly is gathered

33.mnemonic: Some push Alexander forward to make a defense

34.mnemonic: Then they shout him down as a Jew

35.mnemonic: Town clerk quiets the crowd and commends Ephesus

36.mnemonic: He reminds them no one can deny Artemis greatness

37.mnemonic: Exhorts them not to act rashly against these men

38.mnemonic: Warns that courts and proconsuls exist for complaints

39.mnemonic: Affirms lawful assemblies but condemns the present riot

40.mnemonic: Yielding to his counsel the assembly finally disperses

20.mnemonic: REVIVAL OF YOUNG MAN AND PAUL'S FINAL FAREWELL

2.mnemonic: Encouraging believers through Macedonia

3.mnemonic: Vicious plot in Greece changes route

4.mnemonic: Included companions from various cities

5.mnemonic: Vanguard group goes ahead to Troas

6.mnemonic: After Passover they sail to Troas

7.mnemonic: Lords Day gathering with long preaching

8.mnemonic: Oil lamps shine in upper room

9.mnemonic: Fatigued Eutychus falls from window

10.mnemonic: Yet Paul embraces him and declares life

11.mnemonic: Once returned upstairs they break bread

12.mnemonic: Uplifted the young man comforts all

13.mnemonic: Navigating by ship others go to Assos

14.mnemonic: Going aboard they sail to Mitylene

15.mnemonic: Moving past Chios Samos to Miletus

16.mnemonic: Avoiding Ephesus he hastens toward Jerusalem

17.mnemonic: News summons Ephesian elders to Miletus

18.mnemonic: Always they knew his humble service

19.mnemonic: Never shrinking amid plots and tears

20.mnemonic: Declaring all that was profitable publicly

21.mnemonic: Preaching repentance and faith to all

22.mnemonic: Already bound in spirit for Jerusalem

23.mnemonic: Uncertain except chains await him there

24.mnemonic: Life not precious; mission to finish

25.mnemonic: Solemnly he says they will see him no more

26.mnemonic: Free from blood of all men

27.mnemonic: In full he declared Gods whole counsel

28.mnemonic: Nurture yourselves and flock as overseers

29.mnemonic: After his departure savage wolves will enter

30.mnemonic: Leaders among you will speak perverse things

31.mnemonic: For three years he warned with tears

32.mnemonic: Again he commends them to Gods grace

33.mnemonic: Refusing silver gold or fine clothing

34.mnemonic: Evidence shows his hands supplied his needs

35.mnemonic: Working hard he taught giving is blessed

36.mnemonic: Entering prayer he kneels with them all

37.mnemonic: Loud weeping and embraces surround Paul

38.mnemonic: Led to the ship they grieve his departure

21.mnemonic: SOLDIERS ARREST PAUL DURING A RIOT IN JERUSALEM

2.mnemonic: Onward by ship toward Phoenicia

3.mnemonic: Leaving Cyprus they sight Syria and Tyre

4.mnemonic: Disciples in Tyre warn Paul by the Spirit

5.mnemonic: Including families, they kneel and pray on the shore

6.mnemonic: Embarking again they part and board the ship

7.mnemonic: Reaching Ptolemais they greet the brothers

8.mnemonic: Staying in Caesarea with Philip the evangelist

9.mnemonic: Apostle Philip has four prophesying daughters

10.mnemonic: Revelation prophet Agabus comes down from Judea

11.mnemonic: Ropes of Pauls belt bind Agabus own hands and feet

12.mnemonic: Earnestly the believers beg Paul not to go up

13.mnemonic: Steadfast, Paul declares he is ready to die in Jerusalem

14.mnemonic: Trusting the Lord they say His will be done

15.mnemonic: Packing their baggage they set out for Jerusalem

16.mnemonic: Accompanied by disciples bringing Mnason as host

17.mnemonic: Upon arrival the brothers welcome them gladly

18.mnemonic: Leaders James and elders receive Paul the next day

19.mnemonic: Detailed report tells what God did among Gentiles

20.mnemonic: Uncounted Jewish believers are zealous for the law

21.mnemonic: Rumors say Paul teaches Jews to forsake Moses

22.mnemonic: Inevitable gathering will hear that he has arrived

23.mnemonic: Now the elders advise him to join four men in a vow

24.mnemonic: Guided to purify with them and pay their expenses

25.mnemonic: Again they affirm the simple decree for Gentile believers

26.mnemonic: Ritual purification leads Paul and the men into the temple

27.mnemonic: Inciting Jews from Asia seize Paul inside the courts

28.mnemonic: Outcry accuses him of attacking people law and this place

29.mnemonic: Trophimus the Ephesian is assumed brought into the temple

30.mnemonic: In uproar the whole city rushes and drags Paul out

31.mnemonic: News of the riot reaches the Roman commander

32.mnemonic: Joined by soldiers he runs down and stops the beating

33.mnemonic: Enchained with two chains Paul is questioned by the tribune

34.mnemonic: Roaring crowd shouts conflicting accusations around him

35.mnemonic: Up the stairs soldiers carry Paul from the violence

36.mnemonic: Shouting the mob keeps crying Away with him

37.mnemonic: As he nears the barracks Paul asks to speak

38.mnemonic: Leader first supposes he is the Egyptian rebel

39.mnemonic: Explaining he is a Jew of Tarsus Paul requests to address them

40.mnemonic: Motioning from the steps he speaks to the silent crowd

22.mnemonic: WITNESSING BEFORE THE TEMPLE CROWD

1.mnemonic: Words of defense to brothers and fathers

2.mnemonic: In Hebrew speech he quiets the crowd

3.mnemonic: Trained under Gamaliel, truly zealous for law

4.mnemonic: No mercy shown as he persecuted the Way

5.mnemonic: Endorsed by priests with letters to Damascus

6.mnemonic: Suddenly a bright light surrounds him at noon

7.mnemonic: Struck to the ground by a heavenly voice

8.mnemonic: Identifies Himself as Jesus of Nazareth

9.mnemonic: Near companions see light but miss the voice

10.mnemonic: Guided to Damascus to learn Gods will

11.mnemonic: Blinded by glory he is led by hand

12.mnemonic: Esteemed Jew Ananias comes and stands beside him

13.mnemonic: From God he receives sight and calling

14.mnemonic: Ordered to know His will and see the Righteous One

15.mnemonic: Raised up as witness of what he saw and heard

16.mnemonic: Exhorted to arise be baptized and washed

17.mnemonic: Temple vision later falls on him in Jerusalem

18.mnemonic: Hastened away by word that they will not receive him

19.mnemonic: Explains his former violence against believers

20.mnemonic: Taking part when Stephens blood was shed

21.mnemonic: Entrusted now to be sent far to Gentiles

22.mnemonic: Mention of Gentiles enrages the listening crowd

23.mnemonic: People shout he is not fit to live

24.mnemonic: Led into the barracks for scourging examination

25.mnemonic: Exposes his Roman citizenship before the centurion

26.mnemonic: Commander grows concerned that he is a Roman

27.mnemonic: Reminds him that Paul is freeborn

28.mnemonic: On hearing this the examiners withdraw in fear

29.mnemonic: Worried commander releases his bonds the next day

30.mnemonic: Delivered before the council to learn the charge

23.mnemonic: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT PAUL IS ESCORTED

2.mnemonic: New insult strikes him on the mouth

3.mnemonic: Then Paul rebukes the whitewashed wall

4.mnemonic: Humbles himself when he learns high priest

5.mnemonic: Explains he did not recognize him

6.mnemonic: Makes division using Pharisee hope

7.mnemonic: Insists on resurrection of the dead

8.mnemonic: Dispute erupts between Sadducees and Pharisees

9.mnemonic: Divided council becomes violently agitated

10.mnemonic: Lysias rescues Paul from their violence

11.mnemonic: Encouraged that night by the Lord

12.mnemonic: Ordered to testify also in Rome

13.mnemonic: Fierce plot forms among more than forty

14.mnemonic: They bind themselves with a murder oath

15.mnemonic: Hateful plan targets Paul on pretext

16.mnemonic: Excerpt of ambush explained to tribune

17.mnemonic: Nephew hears scheme and warns Paul

18.mnemonic: Informed centurion brings the young man

19.mnemonic: Grim details of ambush told privately

20.mnemonic: Hearing the report, tribune plans transfer

21.mnemonic: That very night soldiers are readied

22.mnemonic: Protective force of hundreds assembled

23.mnemonic: Armed escort leads Paul toward Caesarea

24.mnemonic: Upon departure they travel as far as Antipatris

25.mnemonic: Leaving horsemen to continue with Paul

26.mnemonic: In Caesarea the governor receives him

27.mnemonic: Scroll with Lysiass letter is delivered

28.mnemonic: Explaining charges and Roman protection

29.mnemonic: States accusers must come to present case

30.mnemonic: Commanded to be kept in Herods praetorium

31.mnemonic: Ordered to await accusers arrival there

32.mnemonic: Roman custody now guards Paul securely

33.mnemonic: Trusting God, Paul awaits next hearing

34.mnemonic: Expectant future witness still before rulers

35.mnemonic: Detained yet safely preserved for Rome

24.mnemonic: TRIAL BEFORE THE GOVERNOR FELIX

1.mnemonic: Then high priest Ananias arrives with elders and lawyer

2.mnemonic: Requested by Felix, Tertullus begins accusation

3.mnemonic: In flattery he praises Felix for peace and reforms

4.mnemonic: Appeals for a brief hearing of their case

5.mnemonic: Labels Paul a plague stirring riots among Jews

6.mnemonic: Blames him for profaning the temple before they seized him

7.mnemonic: Extracted from them by commander Lysias, they complain

8.mnemonic: From your examination you can verify these accusations

9.mnemonic: Others, the Jews, join in affirming the charges

10.mnemonic: Responding, Paul gladly offers his defense before Felix

11.mnemonic: Easily they can verify he came to worship twelve days ago

12.mnemonic: They never saw him disputing or stirring up a crowd

13.mnemonic: Hence they cannot prove the things they accuse him of

14.mnemonic: Emphatically he confesses he worships God in the Way

15.mnemonic: Grounded in hope of resurrection of just and unjust

16.mnemonic: Ongoing aim is to keep a clear conscience before God and men

17.mnemonic: Visited Jerusalem to bring alms and offerings to his nation

18.mnemonic: Entered the temple purified, without crowd or disturbance

19.mnemonic: Required witnesses from Asia are not present to accuse

20.mnemonic: None here can state what wrongdoing they found in him

21.mnemonic: Only his cry about resurrection is reason for this trial

22.mnemonic: Resolving to wait for Lysias, Felix adjourns the hearing

23.mnemonic: Freedom under guard is granted, with friends allowed to serve him

24.mnemonic: Entering later with Drusilla, Felix hears of faith in Christ

25.mnemonic: Listening on righteousness, self-control, judgment he becomes afraid

26.mnemonic: Intending to gain money, he often summons Paul to talk

27.mnemonic: Xenial favor to Jews leads Felix to leave Paul imprisoned

25.mnemonic: NEW GOVERNOR HEARS PAUL'S APPEAL

1.mnemonic: New governor Festus arrives in province

2.mnemonic: Early he travels from Caesarea up to Jerusalem

3.mnemonic: Whole Jewish leadership states its case against Paul

4.mnemonic: Grant us a favor they ask planning an ambush

5.mnemonic: Objects that Paul must stay guarded in Caesarea

6.mnemonic: Visits there soon and summons Jewish accusers down

7.mnemonic: Entering the tribunal Festus has Paul brought in

8.mnemonic: Raging Jews hurl many serious yet unproved charges

9.mnemonic: Not guilty Paul claims to law temple or Caesar

10.mnemonic: Offering to please Jews Festus asks about Jerusalem trial

11.mnemonic: Refuses; Paul insists on Caesars court alone

12.mnemonic: Holding to his appeal Festus consults his council

13.mnemonic: End decision is to send Paul to Caesar

14.mnemonic: After some days Agrippa and Bernice visit Festus

15.mnemonic: Report of Pauls case is laid before the king

16.mnemonic: Says Jerusalem Jews demanded he should not live

17.mnemonic: Proclaims Roman custom requires a fair hearing first

18.mnemonic: At once when they came he convened the court

19.mnemonic: Unexpectedly they raised only religious disputes about Jesus

20.mnemonic: Living again is what Paul keeps asserting

21.mnemonic: Still perplexed he had asked about Jerusalem judgment

22.mnemonic: Appeal to the emperor means Paul remains in custody

23.mnemonic: Pleased, Agrippa says he also wants to hear Paul

24.mnemonic: Procession with great pomp brings Agrippa and Bernice

25.mnemonic: Emphasizing Jewish outcry Festus explains the prisoners case

26.mnemonic: Admits he finds nothing worthy of death yet must send him

27.mnemonic: Lacking clear charges he hopes Agrippa will help him write

26.mnemonic: EXTENDED WITNESS BEFORE KING AGRIPPA

1.mnemonic: Extended hand, Paul begins his defense

2.mnemonic: Xultant, he says he is happy to answer

3.mnemonic: Thorough knowledge of Jewish customs in Agrippa

4.mnemonic: Early life among Jews in Jerusalem recounted

5.mnemonic: Known as strict Pharisee from the beginning

6.mnemonic: Defending hope of Gods promise to the fathers

7.mnemonic: Entire twelve tribes hope to attain this promise

8.mnemonic: Doubt why God raising the dead seems incredible

9.mnemonic: Was once convinced he must oppose Jesus

10.mnemonic: Imprisoned many saints and cast votes against them

11.mnemonic: Tortured believers, forcing blasphemy, persecuting afar

12.mnemonic: Near Damascus he traveled with authority to arrest

13.mnemonic: Extra-bright heavenly light surrounds them at midday

14.mnemonic: Spoken voice asks why Saul persecutes and resists goads

15.mnemonic: Saul hears, I am Jesus whom you are persecuting

16.mnemonic: Bidden to rise as servant and witness of vision

17.mnemonic: Escorted by God, sent to Jews and Gentiles

18.mnemonic: From darkness to light their eyes must be opened

19.mnemonic: Obedient to vision, he preached first in Damascus

20.mnemonic: Repentance and deeds befitting repentance proclaimed everywhere

21.mnemonic: Enraged Jews seized him in the temple to kill

22.mnemonic: Kept alive by God to testify to small and great

23.mnemonic: In line with Moses and prophets that Christ would suffer and rise

24.mnemonic: Noisy interruption as Festus cries Paul is mad

25.mnemonic: Gently Paul insists his words are true and reasonable

26.mnemonic: Agrippa knows these events were not done in a corner

27.mnemonic: Gospel-believing question pressed, Paul says he knows Agrippa believes prophets

28.mnemonic: Reply from Agrippa, Almost you persuade me to be Christian

29.mnemonic: If only all hearers might become as I am except these chains

30.mnemonic: Persons presentthe king, governor, Bernicerise and withdraw

31.mnemonic: Privately they agree he has done nothing worthy of death or bonds

32.mnemonic: Appeal to Caesar alone has kept him from release

27.mnemonic: STRANDED ON MALTA AFTER SHIPWRECK ON THE WAY TO ITALY

1.mnemonic: Sailing for Italy under centurion Julius

2.mnemonic: Taken with other prisoners aboard an Adramyttium ship

3.mnemonic: Reaching Sidon where Julius allows Paul to visit friends

4.mnemonic: Against the wind they pass under the lee of Cyprus

5.mnemonic: Navigating off Cilicia and Pamphylia they arrive at Myra

6.mnemonic: Directed onto an Alexandrian grain ship bound for Italy

7.mnemonic: Enduring many slow days they scarcely reach Cnidus

8.mnemonic: Driven along under Crete they come with difficulty to Fair Havens

9.mnemonic: Over time sailing becomes dangerous since the Fast is already past

10.mnemonic: Now Paul warns of impending damage and great loss

11.mnemonic: Master and shipowner persuade the centurion instead of Paul

12.mnemonic: Agreed that they should try to reach Phoenix to winter there

13.mnemonic: Light south wind convinces them to sail close along Crete

14.mnemonic: Tempestuous northeaster suddenly rushes down from the island

15.mnemonic: All control lost they let the ship be driven before the gale

16.mnemonic: Around the little island Cauda they barely secure the lifeboat

17.mnemonic: Fastening cables under the hull they fear running aground on Syrtis

18.mnemonic: Tossed violently they lower the gear and are driven along

19.mnemonic: Exhausted, they throw the ships tackle overboard with their hands

20.mnemonic: Repeated days without sun or stars rob them of hope of rescue

21.mnemonic: Starving for long, they hear Paul say they should have listened

22.mnemonic: However he now urges courage for no life will be lost

23.mnemonic: In the night an angel of the God he serves stands beside him

24.mnemonic: Promised that he must stand before Caesar and all with him be spared

25.mnemonic: With firm faith he declares it will happen just as God told him

26.mnemonic: Required still is that they run aground on some island

27.mnemonic: Exactly fourteen nights later sailors sense land as they are driven

28.mnemonic: Casting the lead they find the water growing shallower

29.mnemonic: Keenly afraid of reefs they drop four anchors and pray for day

30.mnemonic: Operating deceitfully sailors lower the boat pretending to set anchors

31.mnemonic: Not saved unless these men stay in the ship Paul warns the centurion

32.mnemonic: Then soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat and let it fall

33.mnemonic: Hungry crew are urged by Paul to take food for their survival

34.mnemonic: Encouraging them he says not a hair from any head will perish

35.mnemonic: With thanks to God he breaks bread and begins to eat

36.mnemonic: All become encouraged and themselves also take food

37.mnemonic: Yielding the count they number in all two hundred seventy six souls

38.mnemonic: Then when filled they lighten the ship by throwing wheat into the sea

39.mnemonic: On daybreak they do not recognize the land but notice a bay with a beach

40.mnemonic: Intending if possible they plan to run the ship ashore there

41.mnemonic: Though they loose anchors and rudders and hoist foresail, they strike a sandbar

42.mnemonic: All at once the bow sticks fast while the stern is broken by surf

43.mnemonic: Looking to prevent escape the soldiers plan to kill the prisoners

44.mnemonic: Yet wanting to spare Paul the centurion stops them and all reach land safely on boards and pieces of ship

28.mnemonic: SICK HEALED AND PAUL PREACHES IN ROME

1.mnemonic: Shipwreck survivors learn the island is Malta

2.mnemonic: Islanders show unusual kindness and light a fire

3.mnemonic: Collecting sticks Paul is bitten by a viper

4.mnemonic: Knowing justice they expect him to die

5.mnemonic: He simply shakes the snake into the fire

6.mnemonic: Expecting swelling they watch but see no harm

7.mnemonic: At the estate of Publius they are welcomed

8.mnemonic: Laid-up father of Publius is healed by Paul

9.mnemonic: Everyone sick on the island comes and is cured

10.mnemonic: Departing they receive many honors and supplies

11.mnemonic: Alexandrian ship with Twin Gods carries them on

12.mnemonic: Navigating to Syracuse they stay three days

13.mnemonic: Driven by fair south wind they reach Rhegium then Puteoli

14.mnemonic: Paul finds brothers and stays with them seven days

15.mnemonic: At the Forum of Appius and Three Taverns friends meet him

16.mnemonic: Under guard Paul is allowed to live by himself in Rome

17.mnemonic: Leaders of the Jews are summoned after three days

18.mnemonic: Paul explains charges and his hope in Israel's promise

19.mnemonic: Reports from Judea about him have not been received

20.mnemonic: Eager to hear, they arrange a day to listen fully

21.mnemonic: All day he argues from Law and Prophets about Jesus

22.mnemonic: Conflicting responses arise; some believe and some refuse

23.mnemonic: Hard-hearted text from Isaiah is quoted about dull hearing

24.mnemonic: Emphatically he says Gods salvation goes to the Gentiles

25.mnemonic: Some depart in disagreement after hearing his words

26.mnemonic: In his rented house Paul stays two full years

27.mnemonic: Never turning anyone away he welcomes all who come

28.mnemonic: Relentlessly he proclaims Gods kingdom

29.mnemonic: Openly he teaches about the Lord Jesus Christ

30.mnemonic: Muzzle-free, he speaks with all boldness

31.mnemonic: Entire time he remains unhindered in his preaching

1.mnemonic: UNGODLY ARE TO BE JUDGED BY GOD
